facts.fact_text: US-based employers announced 108,435 job cuts in January 2026.

facts.fact_text: January 2026 job cuts were the highest since October and the largest January total since 2009.

facts.fact_text: Transportation announced the highest number of job cuts (31,243), primarily due to UPS.

facts.fact_text: UPS announced it would cut 30,000 jobs after severing ties with Amazon.

evidences.evidence_text: The company announced it would cut 30K jobs after severing ties with Amazon.

facts.fact_text: Technology announced 22,291 job cuts, with the bulk coming from Amazon (16,000).

facts.fact_text: Healthcare companies and health products manufacturers announced 17,107 cuts, the most for the industry since April 2020.

facts.fact_text: Employers announced 5,306 hiring plans, the lowest total for the month since records began in 2009.

claims.claim_text: Employers are less-than-optimistic about the outlook for 2026.
claims.author: Andy Challenger, chief revenue officer for Challenger, Gray & Christmas

evidences.evidence_text: It means most of these plans were set at the end of 2025, signaling employers are less-than-optimistic about the outlook for 2026

evidence.evidence_text: US-based employers announced 108,435 job cuts in January 2026
The company announced it would cut 30K jobs after severing ties with Amazon.
Technology announced 22,291 job cuts, with the bulk coming from Amazon (16K) as it restructures its layers of management.

Generally, we see a high number of job cuts in Q1, but this is a high total for January. It means most of these plans were set at the end of 2025, signaling employers are less-than-optimistic about the outlook for 2026
